entry.dcterms:title: TÁRKI Omnibus 2001/10. Social-political attitudes in Hungary among the adult population.
entry.dcterms:creator: Zsadányi-Nagy, Csaba
entry.dcterms:subject: TÁRKI Joint Research Center TDATA-E95: TÁRKI Omnibus 2001/10. Social-political attitudes in Hungary among the adult population.. data sheet. Version: 2007-02-12
entry.dcterms:creator: 1. Gazsó, Tibor
2. Tóth, Zsolt
3. Rose, Richard
4. Surányi, Péter
5. Molnár, Jenő

entry.dcterms:contributor: University of Strathclyde Centre for the Study of Public Policy (3.)
entry.dcterms:description: 1) popularity of politicians, party preferences, voting behavior, evaluating the work of the government and opposition, political self-categorization, satisfaction with democracy, subjective financial situation, economic expectations 2) support for Hungarys EU accession, opinions about Hungarys NATO membership, admitting refugees, opinions about the extreme right criticism of the terrorist attack against the US in 2001 3) evaluation of political systems, trust in political, public institutions, agreement of group and public interests, respecting human rights, prevalence of corruption, individual financial situation, geographical attachment, national consciousness 4) corruption of the police 5) workplace harms, prevention of accidents, work safety regulations, health 6) knowing insurance companies 7) knowledge about the introduction of th Euro, group consciousness, group identity 8) habits of taking a holiday
entry.dcterms:subject: mass political behavior, attitudes
political ideology
income, property and savings
working conditions
law, crime and legal systems
elections
leisure, tourism and sport
person
survey data
cross-section

A multi-stage proportionally stratified random probability sample representative of the Hungarian adult population. Unsuccessful inquiries were substituted with supplementary addresses, where persons to be interviewed were selected on the basis of the Leslie Kish key.
face-to-face interview
A
entry.dcterms:rights: Publications based on TÁRKI data collections should acknowledge those sources, primary investigators and depositors.
